title: Bitcoin Technical Fundamentals Quiz
description: Test your understanding of Bitcoin's technical architecture, cryptography, and blockchain mechanics

questions.question: What is the maximum number of Bitcoin that will ever exist?
questions.explanation: Bitcoin has a hard cap of 21 million coins, making it truly scarce and deflationary by design.

questions.question: What cryptographic function does Bitcoin use for mining?
questions.explanation: Bitcoin uses SHA-256 (Secure Hash Algorithm 256-bit) for its proof-of-work consensus mechanism.

questions.question: What is a 'block' in Bitcoin?
questions.explanation: A block is a group of transactions that are validated and added to the blockchain together.

questions.question: What is the 'halving' event in Bitcoin?
options: When Bitcoin price drops by half
When mining reward is cut in half
When block time is reduced by half
questions.explanation: The halving event occurs every 210,000 blocks (approximately every 4 years) and cuts the mining reward in half.

questions.question: What is a 'Merkle tree' in Bitcoin?
options: A data structure for efficient transaction verification
questions.explanation: A Merkle tree is a data structure that allows efficient verification of transaction inclusion in a block without downloading the entire block.

questions.question: What is 'proof of work' in Bitcoin?
options: A mathematical proof of transaction validity
A consensus mechanism requiring computational work
questions.explanation: Proof of work is a consensus mechanism where miners must solve complex mathematical puzzles to validate blocks and secure the network.

questions.question: What is a 'UTXO' in Bitcoin?
questions.explanation: UTXO stands for Unspent Transaction Output, which represents the amount of Bitcoin available to spend from a previous transaction.

questions.question: What is the 'difficulty adjustment' in Bitcoin?
options: Adjusting mining difficulty to maintain 10-minute block time
questions.explanation: Bitcoin automatically adjusts mining difficulty every 2016 blocks to maintain an average 10-minute block time regardless of network hash rate.

questions.question: What is 'segwit' in Bitcoin?
options: A soft fork that separates signature data
A hard fork that increases block size
questions.explanation: Segregated Witness (segwit) is a soft fork that separates signature data from transaction data, improving scalability and enabling Lightning Network.

questions.question: What is the 'Lightning Network'?
options: A second-layer scaling solution for instant payments
questions.explanation: The Lightning Network is a second-layer scaling solution that enables instant, low-fee Bitcoin transactions by creating payment channels between users.

feedback.passing: Good understanding of Bitcoin's technical fundamentals!
feedback.excellent: Excellent grasp of Bitcoin's technical architecture and mechanics!
feedback.needsImprovement: Review Bitcoin's core technical concepts including blockchain, cryptography, and consensus mechanisms.
